title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 20.8 - Duplicate titles
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 20.8 - Duplicate titles

State Regulations

If a certificate of title is lost, destroyed or
mutilated, the owner may apply for a duplicate certificate of title. An
application for a duplicate certificate of title (Form MV-802) must be obtained
from an issuing office of the department, appropriately completed and forwarded
to the Title Bureau, Department of Motor Vehicles, South Mall, Albany, NY
12228, together with the appropriate fee. In addition, the nontransferable
registration for the vehicle may be required to be presented to the issuing
office. If so, the registration shall be returned to the owner, and may bear
the notation "Duplication Title Applied For." If the certificate of title has
been mutilated and not lost or destroyed, the mutilated certificate of title
must also be forwarded with the application. If such application is proper and
sufficient, a duplicate certificate of title will be issued. If the certificate
of title which was lost is later recovered, the recovered certificate of title
must be forwarded to the title bureau at the address above. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
20.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
